From whence cometh wars and fightings among you? Come they not from hence, even of your concupiscentia (lusts) that war in your members?
Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.
Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consume it upon your voluptas (pleasures).
Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the amicitia (friendship) of the world is enmity with God? whosoever therefore will be a amicus (friend) of the world is the enemy of God.
Do ye think that the scriptura (scripture) saith in vain, The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy?
But he giveth more gratia (grace) wherefore he saith, God resisteth the proud, but giveth gratia (grace) unto the humble.
Submit yourselves therefore to God Resist the diabolus (devil), and he will flee from you.
Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you Cleanse your manus (hands), ye sinners; and purify your corda (hearts), ye double minded.
Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to luctus (mourning), and your joy to tristitia (sorrow).
Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall exalt you.

Speak not evil one of another, brethren He that speaketh evil of his frater (brother) speaketh evil of the lex (law); and judgeth the lex (law): but if thou judgest the lex (law), thou art not a factor (doer) of the lex (law), but a judex (judge).
There is one legislator (lawgiver) who is able to save and to destroy who art thou that judgest another?
Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a civitas (city), and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain:
Whereas ye know not what shall be on the crastinus (morrow).
For that that is your vita (life) is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.
For that ye ought to say, If the Dominus (Lord) will, we shall live, and do this, or that.
But now ye glory in your ostentatio (boasting): all such rejoicing is evil.
Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth it not, to him it is peccatum (sin).
